Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: Appendix:Variations of "mom"

English

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • (UK) IPA(key): /mɒm/
  • (US) IPA(key): /mɑm/
  • Rhymes: -ɒm, -ɑm
  • Homophone: mom

Etymology 1

[edit]

Proprialisation of mom.

Proper noun

[edit]

Mom

  1. (informal) One’s mother.
    Synonyms: Mam, Mommy, Mother, Mummy, Mum
    Antonym: Dad
    I wish Mom and Dad didn't argue so much.

Etymology 2

[edit]

Transliteration of Khmer មុំ (mum, “corner, angle”).

Proper noun

[edit]

Mom (plural Moms)

  1. A surname from Khmer.
Statistics
[edit]
  • According to the 2010 United States Census, Mom is the 34495th most common surname in the United States, belonging to 656 individuals. Mom is most common among Asian/Pacific Islanders (79.12%) and White (12.04%) individuals.

Etymology 3

[edit]

Transliteration of Thai หม่อม (mɔ̀m)

Noun

[edit]

Mom

  1. prefix of a female commoner who marries a royal prince.

Anagrams

[edit]
  • MMO
